website_summaries.verdict: An expensive camera bag with features that will keep your entire mobile setup safe and secure while traveling in style.
pros: Quality build, comfortable to wear, and equipped with special webbing that allows you to add additional attachments
Interior and exterior pockets give this backpack plenty of room for extras
cons: Despite the compact appearance the bag is larger than some would expect
Though there's room to add additional accessories, it may be too pricey for beginners

customer_reviews.title: Large bag for a lot of gear, but exterior straps release easily
customer_reviews.text: This backpack if one of the better bags I have tried for my gear. I mainly purchased for use while shooting a wedding. I previously had a rolling bag, but was always worried about someone taking my stuff. It has enough space to hold 2 cameras, lenses, and accessories for when I'm either geared for photography or cinematography. It also has good cushioning for distributing weight. The only downside are the external clips it comes with for accessories that you can attach (like a tripod or a gimbal). For some reason, they easily unbuckle when bumped and I don't have enough confidence in them to use them. This makes all the potentially great exterior attachment points useless.
customer_reviews.author: NoNoBadCat

customer_reviews.title: a BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a BEAST! I recently took a 3 week trip. I had 10 flights throughout the duration of the trip. During two of those flights, the over head compartments were completely full. I didn't have a choice but to check this along with normal luggage. I was not amused and feared the worse. This backpack is so well made, it survived the baggage handlers and conveyors. All my camera and laptop gear didn't have any problems, nothing broken. I will warn you, this is NOT a small back back, but you can carry everything you'd need in one indescribable backpack. I use this on plane trips and camping.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera Backup for Day Hike Use
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this pack, I use it daily to transport my gear (camera and laptop) from home to office and I use it on the weekend to hike into remote locations for landscape photos. The construction is very solid and like the MOLLE on the outside for attaching extra pouches. The tripod holder works really well. The water bottle holder that comes with it, isn't great, but with the MOLLE being a standard attachment system it was easy to find a better one to attach to the pack. I run a outdoor YouTube channel and I am constantly carrying camera gear into the back country this pack so far has met my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Primal Outdoors

customer_reviews.title: What airlines will this fit?
customer_reviews.text: Great travel bag when you need to bring a large bit of kit with you. This a large and heavy bag (close to 6 lbs) so keep that in mind. It does accommodate a good amount of gear and is solid enough to handle the load without deforming or falling apart. It was able to hold 25 lbs/11kg with ease, its just a matter if your back can take the load. I plan on updating this periodically with airlines/planes this has been taken on and how it fit. Airlines used: Japan Airlines (JAL) | Economy | Boeing 777-300er: Would not fit under the seat, stuck out a fair bit. Would need to put in overhead bin.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could have used it....
customer_reviews.text: the Lowepro 450 AW arrived but i discovered it was too big for my camera equipment needs. i might have grown into it eventually but i found it to be too deep for my Canon equipment. another thing that caused me to return it was that the dividers, while plentiful did not allow me to change the arrangement of the 2 big main dividers. looked great in the photos but everyone's equipment is a little different. i opted for a smaller and cheaper backpack from Altura which fit my needs better. recommended except for the versatility handicap.
customer_reviews.author: JHN

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to love this backpack but at the end of the day ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this backpack but at the end of the day the straps are just not made comfortably. Shame on lowepro for making such a nice backpack and then sewing on flimsy, barely padded straps. Bag it's self is protective, smartly designed, and looks ready for any battle. Like I said, the straps are integral to carrying gear and these just didn't cut it. I went with a similar designed Sony Backpack, and the straps are padded, reinforced, I could walk for miles comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: I have both the Lowepro Tactic 350AW and 450 AW. They are well made and comfortable. The molle system allows many added strap-on bags and accessories and can make these bags heavy. The 350 AW straps seem to be made with the weight limits that this bag can carry. The 450 AW has the same straps as the 350 AW but the 450 AW bag can carry a lot more and this results in the straps not being as comfortable. I believe Lowepro should have made the 450 AW straps thicker or wider in proportion to the weight and size that this bag is capable of.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: A pro body with a 70-200 on it can pretty much only go in the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Very limiting design. A pro body with a 70-200 on it can pretty much only go in the bottom. Where you waste a bunch of space installing dividers to try to hold it from flopping all over the place. Putting it in for top access means you lose both bottom openings. The area under where you gear sits rounded and filled with seams. As a result nothing sits flat. I wanted to love this bags because it looked perfect for what I wanted, however looks can not make up for poor functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: Fits 2 cameras with attached lenses. One long 100-400mm lens attached to my 7D Mark II and a wide angle zoom lens on my other camera. Also plenty of room for a couple other lenses, filters, remotes, spare batteries and stuff. There is a good amount of zippered compartments as well. Material, stitching and zippers are all made of durable materials. I like that there is a quick access zippers, to get to both cameras quickly when required. Lowepro make quality bags!
customer_reviews.author: Dragon1016

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to finally get a good bag to replace the basic bags I've used in the past (the zipper on the old one was ripping). Not only am I able to fit two gripped cameras with lenses mounted, but I can fit more lenses, a speedlight and other accessories, and still have room left over. Add on the fact that I can put less critical accessories in bags attached via the MOLLE system on the back, and I have a wonderful bag. The only problem is it's very easy to fit everything, making the bag heavier.
customer_reviews.author: mhickman

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this bag
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bag! I have a larger thinktank bag that I take to weddings but I wanted something I didn't mind getting muddy or dirty when I traveled or did landscape/wildlife photography. Really love how this opens from the back and it's the perfect size for a landscape kit with a 70-200 f2.8 I currently have it loaded with a nikon D800E, nikon D4,16-35 f4, 70-200 f2.8, 50mm f1.4, Lee's filter holder, Lee Big Stopper, Lee polarizing filter, and other bits and bobs. I could probably rearrange and put more in but it's a great weight to travel with now and I have everything I need. I highly recommend this bag, especially for the outdoors photographer.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: The bag kicks
customer_reviews.text: This bag is rad. Great for customizing where everything goes. I fit my Canon 5D Mark III, 70-200mm, Tamron 24-70mm, Canon 15-35mm, Mavic pro/controller/charger, external drive, gopro/batteries/charger, water bottles of all sizes with the included pouches...phew. What else...it fits it all. Straps are a bit low on padding, not as bad as other people have made them out to be but low on padding never the less. When adjusted properly, the bag keeps the weight close to the body with help from the hip harness (included). Favorite bag to date.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this for long-time but the price was high. I purchased this at a discounted price when the new version came to the market. It is a very durable, well thought and comfortable photo backpack. It can carry a lot of photo gear comfortably. The molle option allow for several additional pouches to be used for further configuration. I regret not purchasing this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Roy-E

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to travel. I was able to fit a larger DSLR Canon 1DX, 3 lenses (50mm, 24-70mm, 70-200mm), as well as my Mavic 2 Drone with all batteries and accessories. Everything fit comfortably and securely. I was very happy to be able to bring all of this gear on hikes all over Colorado with me. It's very comfortable to wear, although my gear was heavy, and everything is accessible from the many different pockets. I'm very very happy with this bag.
customer_reviews.author: A. H. Schurman

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier version of this bag that worked well for years. It is still working well for a friend. This new one is better. Excellent use of space. I have a camera, several lenses and a flash in it with room to spare. It's comfortable on my back. The quick grab zipper is a nice addition. I believe it will last me a long time
customer_reviews.author: John P. Salmons

customer_reviews.title: Finally a camera bag that I can travel with.
customer_reviews.text: I carry a D810 with 70-200 lens along with my 13" laptop. The pouches are designed perfectly. The side access is the highlight. I access the camera through the side pocket while I keep all the rest of my stuff on the top access. I used the bag for my recent trip to Costa Rica and Mexico and boy we did a lot of walking around. This bag held well. Very well built. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Binoy

customer_reviews.title: My daily  camera bag
customer_reviews.text: Pro tactic 450 is a great bag. Going on a west coast road trip for 2 weeks, I took 2 camera bodies, 6 lenses,flash etc. All packed safely in the bag and bag shows no poor craftsmanship or wear from the trip. The waist support like any large backpacking bag really can be a back saver with bag at capacity. The back access on this bag makes it worry free about equipment falling out and security from pickpockets in city. Comes with external expansion pieces to add water bottle, tripod extra zip compartment, built in rainfly. this is my go to bag daily and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S. Nelson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag for about 10 months, shooting at least 3 weekends a month. It is very durable and well built. It get tossed around pretty good and other than a little dirt looks brand new. I really like the opening being on the back so you can set the bag in the dirt and when it is time to go your back stays clean. If I had to do it again I would get the smaller version. The big version holds so much that I tend to take more gear than I need. I usually have 2 bodies and 3 lenses and it still has room for more stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Titanium

customer_reviews.title: So much storage, comfy to use, great purchase for any active photographer who finds themselves with more than one camera body!
customer_reviews.text: Fits so much gear--no matter what my loadout is I always have enough space. Most recently I had rented an additional camera body and wide angle lens, and added it to my bag, managing to fit 3 full frame bodies and 4 lenses in total all with room to spare! The laptop storage pocket is crucial for me as well as I often have to edit a few photos right away. It fits my 15.4" macbook pro with ease. It does all this while still being comfortable to use. Such a great offering from Lowepro!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan K

customer_reviews.title: Can't actually fit 15 inch laptop but still pretty great
customer_reviews.text: It can not hold my 15 inch laptop. It's not particularly thick as far as laptops go so that is very disappointing. It feels very solid. Some of the compartments felt a little too rigid for my liking. There's a lot more storage space than you realize with the included modular pouches and the space in the top of the bag. When it's very heavy it's not the most comfortable. When I have my camera and lenses without my drone is when this bag feels perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Blaney

customer_reviews.title: The perfect bag does not exist.... this one is close though.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag with multiple points of entry. Very customizable inside (like most camera bags) and outside (unlike most camera bags) due to the molle system of straps all over it. Comes with a couple of molle accessories, a tripod foot bag, and a zipper pouch, but you could completely cover the outside of this with pouches and doodads if you like.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for airline bins. Slim design. Comfortable on back.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for air travel. More spacious than it looks and comfortable to wear for long periods of time...hiking a mountain or around town. Seems pretty durable. Zippers are not heavy duty like some of my other bags. I love the many access points and that you can clamp stuff to the exterior webbing loops. Overall worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: NBA Films

customer_reviews.title: Best camera pack that I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best camera pack that I have ever owned. Holds all my gear (D7100 w/ battery grip), 70-200mm f2.8, 50mm f1.8, 18-270 mm f5.6, 2 flashes, remote trigger system, filters, other misc gear and 15” MacBook Pro. This fits perfectly under the seat on any airline and have had no issues whatsoever travel. Pack is designed well and doesn't hurt your back. If updated this review in 2019. I have had no issues whatsoever with this pack. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice but way too big for a Camera, Tripod, and a few lenses. It looks huge on your back.
customer_reviews.text: The pack itself is great but it was way too big for me. I am an amature photographer and I need something smaller to fit my needs. This would have limited me as to when I would take my gear with me. I want something that I am ok with picking up anytime I leave the house, not just when I specifically going out to photograph. I ended up ordering the Flipside 300 and hope that will be a better fit for me. The Flipside is $50 cheaper from B&H than it is on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This pack is amazing (and I must say I'm picky when it comes ...
customer_reviews.text: This pack is amazing (and I must say I'm picky when it comes to bags), it fits all of my gear (Nikon D7100 with 18-105mm, 35-135mm, 50mm, 40mm macro, 70-300mm lenses, my gopro, remote shutter, batteries, cables, chargers, adapters, two speed lights). Beware that the laptop compartment is not that big, i think it was designed for mac book because my 15.6" Toshiba laptop is too thick for it. Still, I never intended it to be carrying my pc. It comes also with straps for your tripod, puch for water bottle and other accesories. As far as traveling with it is comfortable, in planes I have no trouble getting it overhead in my trip to Brazil.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Andrés Pérez

customer_reviews.title: I hate the black color and techy appearance, but love the organization and carrying convenience
customer_reviews.text: I hate that this backpack is all black and screams "Expensive camera inside!" but I love how convenient it is to store my camera inside the pack and organize my accessories when I am on the go. The multiple pockets on the outside that lead to the main compartment make it super easy to get at my gear. I can either open a small top or side pocket to grab one or two things at a time, or I can set the backpack on the ground and open the main compartment and survey everything in the pack at once.
customer_reviews.author: Review Name

customer_reviews.title: This bag is awesome. It has tons of space and tons of ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome. It has tons of space and tons of different ways to access your gear. I can fit so much gear I currently have a dslr with 70-200 and 4 other lenses.their is also a flash, Charger, spare batteries a drone with controller and accessories and their is still a little room to spare. I will say it fits so much gear it can get a little heavy but that’s what happens when you can fit so much gear in one back pack. It will also easily hold a Tripod and other things outside of the bag. This bag is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: ProChiropractic
customer_reviews.text: It's a dang good bag, typical Lowepro quality. I've been using Think Tank stuff for years and I'm regretting not staying with them, but this will do fine. The Think Tank products are a little higher quality in my experience and a little more creative in their approach to bag/pack design, but make no mistake, this Lowepro is very good quality and works very well. I carry two bodies (1Ds Mk III and a 5D mkIII) 5 lenses and all the supporting items with no problems other than the chiropractor bill.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vanorden

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: A versatile medium sized camera bag which can carry other items as well. I use the top part for clothes and jackets. The side access for cameras and long lens. Comfortable to carry 25 pound load. Fits in overheads and under-seat storage on standard planes and the larger commuter aircraft such as Embraer 145. I tried several configurations of the interior before I was satisfied. One hint, take a picture of each setup before you try another. Every new setup isn't necessarily better than the last one!! This is my best camera bag yet.
customer_reviews.author: Docker

customer_reviews.title: I really like this bag.
customer_reviews.text: I primarily take photos in austere conditions at night. It's opening mechanics is what sold me. I can drop it face down in the dirt flip open the back and not worry about dirt getting in it or it tipping over. It fits my big lens with three others and literally everything else and the little pockets on the inside keep the smaller items organized. It work fine with Molly adapters really can't say enough about it.
customer_reviews.author: aaron c carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack.. My  Nikon D5 lenses and Mavic Pro 2 fits great
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for a good trip! My Backpack trip has: Nikon D5 + lenses 58mm + 70-200mm and 28-70MM Mavic Pro 2 fits + controller + 2 extra batteries INsta360 One x - Camera and battery Cookies and sunglasses Nikon Flash and other acessories for Mavic pro inside!
customer_reviews.author: Jonnys Bazar

customer_reviews.title: Overall it is a good backpack and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Overall it is a good backpack and very sturdy. The only thing I would have like to have is some different size dividers and some side compartments. I have 2 Nikon camera's, 2 flashes, and several lenses. What was messing up most off my arrangement was the 70-200mm lens. I probably should have went with a larger one to accommodate all of my equipment. I was able to get the main gear in but had trouble putting my accessories in. There was a couple of add on's but it would have been nice if the cases were bigger. These mount on the outside of the pack.
customer_reviews.author: Garland

customer_reviews.title: FITS A RONIN M + MIRORLESS CAMERA + AUDIO EQUIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: Fits a ton of stuff!! I can honestly say this backpack has changed my life lol. I fit a ton of gear in it when I'm doing audio and video on location for musicians. Really pushing the "Modular" part of this backpack as I tear out the walls and stick a couple of them together to create a layer of protection between all the gear. I also purchased rolls of velcro to secure everything inside during travel. This is my go to when flying with this much gear. The straps dig in to my shoulders pretty hard with this much stuff in it but definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I just bought before new model come out
customer_reviews.text: If I had known about the new model coming out, I would have waited. Who could know? The only thing they should have done differently is used standard military looping instead of their own design. Many more optional bags could have been attached better.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Cool pack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag for camera gear and keeps my equipment safe. Pretty much a pack geared for camera use only, but does that well for my loadout, is nice looking and kinda tech/tactical. I especially like the tripod holder and the Mille straps may come in useful!
customer_reviews.author: Anon Ymous

customer_reviews.title: Nice setup...won’t last..I’m so bummed
customer_reviews.text: I loved this bag. I mean loved it. I carried my a7riii, a6500 and 4 Gmaster lenses. It unfortunately started to tear on the right shoulder strap at the one year mark :0( I am so sad about this. I loved this bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Consoomer_at_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: I like my bag. Wish the shoulder strap was more padded and wider
customer_reviews.text: Love my new bag. Fits both my camera and a couple of lens, depending on what I pack a sped light as well. Shoulder straps could be thicker and more padded. Went on a hike and could see them cutting in my shoulder a bit if I didn’t have my thick coat on.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bag, super versatile
customer_reviews.text: Literally only thing I dont like about it are the straps, they should be way thicker considering this thing can carry a flagship camera plus a couple L series lenses which means your weight will add up fast. Top comparment access for a large size camera like the 1D series is perfect, even can wrangle a frotto quick release on there too!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Sayegh

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced, with space that carefully separates and protects my equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Well balanced, with space that carefully separates and protects my equipment. At the same time the Pro Tactic is amazingly compact, so it is easy to travel with. Very sophisticated tough design. Just completed my first cross country trip, zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this backpack, well worth the investment! It's sturdy and light. It distributes the weight way better than my cheap-o one. I have a couple more lenses I can fit in this one and it feels like half the weight of the cheap one I got. I love the padding, I love the design, I love the hardshell and the sturdy protection this gives. Would buy it again, no doubt about it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Esplin

customer_reviews.title: I would but this again! But I have suggestions to Lowpro
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had a zip closed net cover so stuff disnt fall out when you open it. I would have liked the option of a brighter color. I also wish the waterproof cover was detachable. I use this bag 90% for travel... it's a tad heavy at about 5.5lbs empty, but it keeps everything safe. ALSO reinforced bottom would be really nice. When i went outta town, i ripped out ALL the dividers and pit my tripod and surge protector in the middle diagonally and fit everything around them.
customer_reviews.author: Jvincent S.

customer_reviews.title: BEST CAMERA BACKPACK I OWN.
customer_reviews.text: Best camera bag ever. fits my drone, my Sony a6300, lenses and everything. In the top compartment I can even put my clothes for the day of shooting. The bag feels great, the materials are great and you can feel its protecting your stuff. Very very very nice bag. ill recommend it. I know its an expensive bag but its worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Malalonchys

customer_reviews.title: Everything fits!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is big enough and versatile enough to hold my 5X7 field camera, lenses, film holders, tripod, dark cloth, etc. This will be much easier to carry than the 70 to 80 pounds I humped when I was climbing mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Merle  J

customer_reviews.title: Gift for a filmmaker and he LOVES it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera backpack was on my boyfriend's wishlist, so I bought it for his birthday. He absolutely loves it. He's still discovering pockets and uses for everything. His laptop and iPad fit perfectly, as well as his fancy camera, attachments, etc. He can even throw in a bottle of water and attach various things to the outside of the bag. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: wtfproductions

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag and the price over the f-stop bags ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded to the 450 from the 350. Love this bag and the price over the f-stop bags out there. Inconspicuous and very functional with lots of access and configurations for your gear. Took some time to organize, and could use more dividers, but nothing that I can dock against the product! great work Lowepro.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for strong backs and travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for strong backs and travel. You can real pack this bag to gills. The only issue is you then have to carry the have bag. If you travel a lot or commute it is the perfect bag. I have not used my Pelican in over a year and 5 international trips.
customer_reviews.author: E. Browne

customer_reviews.title: ... 1 wedding and I can now say it's a great backpack. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this on 3 camping trips and 1 wedding and I can now say it's a great backpack. Sturdy, durable, lightweight, with plenty of adjustable storage. It kept my camera, lenses, and gear all safe and snug. I really like how adjustable the backpack straps are, it actually fits me comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Dale McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great drone and camera backpack
customer_reviews.text: I’m enjoying this bag. Works great with my mavic pro 2 zoom and my dslr camera, and I still have plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bonilla

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. Next to others that I have had I find this bag is absolutely perfect and very easy to organize. The quality of the build material is top notch and the zippers are heavy duty. I can pack equipment into the bag which can make it obviously quite heavy. However I find that even with the bag being loaded that my shoulders are not fatigued st the end of a day of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but the quality control is lacking.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the product for 12 days and the seams are coming undone. The quality control on this item is sub par. When I noticed the seam on the strap coming apart we double checked the bag and found multiple spots with long threads that just appear to be unfinished for the price of this product I do not think it is unreasonable to expect a higher quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: ) Wish it could stand upright on its own a little better. Otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Traveled Thailand with this over the summer. Fit about 3-4 days worth of clothes and my DJ kit in there (Serato SL3 Box, control vinyl, cables, headphones, laptop, etc.) Wish it could stand upright on its own a little better. Otherwise, it was extremely comfortable and adjusted to meet the needs of a traveling DJ well
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Best photo backpack
customer_reviews.text: I have owned numerous photo backpacks, and this is the best in the market. It is well-built, sturdy, bang proof, and zips from the back, which is a new design feature I have never seen.
customer_reviews.author: crawdad

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: I had the peak design backpack. That was a nightmare on location. This bag (450) fits all my gear, rugged as heck, secure and worth the price. My only complaint is the compartments on the back. Can’t fit much in there but I believe the 2nd version of this bag fixes that.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Zastrow

customer_reviews.title: I love this backpack
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. First of all I am happy and impressed with the security of having the zippered side toward my back. When you take it off the front goes on the ground to open it. Its a backpack so of course if you have two camera bodies and a 70-200 f2.8 lens its going to be heavy but so far this seems to distribute the weight well.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Rubery

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product - wish it would have come with more options for dividers, but still good deal, high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Scott W. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Best DSLR backpack!!
customer_reviews.text: Love the versatility to create your own storage. Can fit two dslrs and lenses. Large but still comfortable to carry.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lester

customer_reviews.title: Quality Camera Backpack, at a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: Tremendous camera backpack. Quality build. I had a Canon backpack that I had outgrown. This bag came well reviewed, and recommended by Thomas Heaton. Based on that, I choose this backpack, and I am very pleased with it after a trip I recently took. It conforms to TSA carry-on dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: S Durkin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bag, plenty of storage for camera gear
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy bag, plenty of storage for camera gear. I'm not jazzed about it opening from the back. The slot for the lap top is part of the camera space so its all a bit tight but overall, a very good bag that will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Robert  Page

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, well-made backpack for your gear
customer_reviews.text: I'd actually never even considered a backpack design for camera gear until I came across this. It is a little larger than I expected, and I could have probably gone with the 350 rather than the 450, BUT I likely won't need another bag/pack for many years to come. I'm sure it will get completely filled in a year or two, lol.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cumpian

customer_reviews.title: ​What an Amazing Bag.
customer_reviews.text: ​What an Amazing Bag... I bought this bag and was debating whether or not to go with the 450 or the 350... I decided to go with the 450 and it was the best decision. It is perfect for hikes, on the airplane and regular use... Overall its an amazing bag!! Excellent product!!
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: Carries a load comfortably.
customer_reviews.text: I carry a couple of bodies and several lenses, this back back still feels good even after a couple of hours of hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, we own two of them now.
customer_reviews.text: I tried various bags, starting with the cheapest option, on the way up to this LowPro 450. It has hard casing, plenty of padding inside, excellent quality. It's our second LowPro camera bag (my wife and I own the LowPro 350 AW as well). Excellent purchase and worth the extra money to protect our expensive camera equipment for our photography & videography business.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Butler

customer_reviews.title: 15.6 inch laptop will work
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this all over the world. I can fill it to the 12kg limit of most planes and never get a second look when getting on a plane. As for the laptop compartment, I have a 15.6" laptop and it fits. Not well, but it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, will likely own for a lifetime.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for storing ALL my gear. The only downside is it gives my brain a headache trying to decide how to organize the inside with all the atachments (joking! lol).
customer_reviews.author: Goldman714

customer_reviews.title: Super strong construction
customer_reviews.text: Many differents setups inside and outside the bag. Plenty of space to fit my camera with 2 lens and Mavic Pro with controller including chargers and batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Julio C. Vega

customer_reviews.title: I love pretty much everything about it
customer_reviews.text: I love pretty much everything about it. Like many, I went through about a dozen of backpacks trying to find a perfect one, and this thing fits well, keeps a lot of gear and is infinitely tweakable. It can take a large format camera with two lenses and other stuff and a DSLR with two more.
customer_reviews.author: DzFr

customer_reviews.title: Fits everything I need and more. But needs beefier straps.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for my needs. Able to keep my two gripped Nikon bodies, 14-24, 24-70, 70-200, 60mm macro, 50mm 1.4, two flashes and various cables. It's a work tank. The only issue is the straps could be a little more padded. I find when it's fully loaded that the straps tend to dig in awkwardly into my shoulders and slide off when walking.
customer_reviews.author: Keith V.

customer_reviews.title: This is the best bag... Seriously it's the best
customer_reviews.text: You don't need to look any further. I've used this bag for about 4 years now. It has held up perfectly! No issues, nothing broken, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Mitchell Kerrr

customer_reviews.title: This has got to be one of THE best bags on the market anywhere at any price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag for my wife right after I bought her new 70D camera. She started her own photogrpahy business, and the bag she had initially was getting worn, and becoming too small to accommodate her gear. This bag is AWESOME! Well made, plenty of room, easy to carry... perfect for her!
customer_reviews.author: James Spicer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely like this Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely like this Backpack. Fits all my accessories and my Dslr and my Mirrorless cameras. The adjustable straps on the outside and the attachments are a great addition
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... limitless possible configurations and the external molly system is great for customization as well
customer_reviews.text: The bag has limitless possible configurations and the external molly system is great for customization as well. I would have preferred more of the stiff dividers rather than the cheaper flimsy ones. The main dividers are similar in quality to F-stop’s but why not make the whole system the same? The bag is quite heavy though but that adds to its toughness I suppose. It does scream “I have a lot of expensive camera gear in here” though.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Hyett

customer_reviews.title: Roomy, comfortable, durable
customer_reviews.text: When I head outdoors for a photo walk I don’t want to let the opportunity for a great shot pass because I don’t have the equipment I need. This backpack is comfortable, holds everything I need with room to spare, and has shown itself to be durable. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hauls it all!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. All of my gear fits, including secure storage for multiple filter options. I like the quick access side which allows me to remove one camera body and lens set up without having to open the entire kit.
customer_reviews.author: Valrie J Dyhouse

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed nothing fits like in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed nothing fits like in the picture, Seems to have a lot of room but it doesn't, a regular 70-200mm lens cannot fit the way it supposed to be on this picture, it takes a lot of space, things were better fitted on my old camera bag, the only good thing about this product is that is kind of hard case. Now realize why the price went down so dramatically.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo E Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for travel. Right fit for a 15" Mac Pro. Really solid padding, almost an exoskeleton. Love the little things, key clips etc that make it really work for everyday life. Excellent company and products.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I just love it. It's big enough to contain my camera along with two lenses and two laptops 15" and all the small photography materials.
customer_reviews.author: FiReTiTi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bag and nice looking too but regarding functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bag and nice looking too but regarding functionality: because that curves in the both sides of the bag you can not place your dslr correctly and firmly in the bag near the eather sides and when you load it with a laptop or a tablet the back of the bag becomes hard and uncomfortable(that's why 3 stars). Other than that this bag would be close to perfect (But Its Not) for any activity other than 2 or more days hiking. You can find better bags within this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Emad D.

customer_reviews.title: Best. Bag. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: The best bag ever. Finally found something that fits my needs! Perfect for traveling. I guarantee it'll last 10+ years at least.
customer_reviews.author: caymanmama

customer_reviews.title: Durable, spacious - Perfect for traveling videographer.
customer_reviews.text: We have a Canon 5D Mark ii and Mark iii, along with a C100 and plenty of lenses. This pack is perfect to carry not only all of our camera bodies, but also the lenses and other video equipment we bring with us. All while being comfortable to wear thanks to the waist strap. I highly recommend this durable pack above anything else I’ve owned.
customer_reviews.author: David Moum

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I made the decision to purchase this bag. It's well made and the removable/customizable inserts are great. Once loaded down it is a bit on the heavy side but knowing I have everything I need in one place makes it a non issue.. Its comfortable to wear even on long hikes. Tripod holder and straps work well. Don't hesitate to buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shoulder and waist straps are not as robust as I ...
customer_reviews.text: Shoulder and waist straps are not as robust as I thought they would be when looking at the pictures. Not sure how good/comfortable they would be when wearing for extended times... But it still a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Top Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bag for those who carry multiple cameras
customer_reviews.text: Fits all my gear and more. I like the versatility of this bag. You can configure it to any gear you have.
customer_reviews.author: Yemi S

customer_reviews.title: I love this bag!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. It’s durable, keeps your gear safe and it’s essy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Shields

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have owned over 7 different camera bags. This is by far the best. After watching the videos on the lowepro site, I expected it to be a huge thick bag based on the amount that it could hold. I was pleasantly surprised when I pulled it out and it had a much slimmer profile than my ThinkTank Hard Drive backpack that isn't even able to hold as much. Great design, cool accessory holders that come for free, great confort.....its simply one heck of a cool back all around. I've been a ThnkTank guy for a while (own 5 of their bags) but Lowepro won me over with this bag
customer_reviews.author: Soby

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag holds everything you need! Was a great price. Bag is very comfortable while loaded. Rain cover is attached, so no problems losing it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this case because I'm able to store every camera
customer_reviews.text: Love this case because I'm able to store every camera, lens and accessory in it. When packing for a trip is simple grab and go. If I don't need everything and want to go light on a hike, I have an easy time selecting the items I want and transfer to a smaller bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ken N.

customer_reviews.title: Best camera bag E.V.E.R.
customer_reviews.text: So good. Carry a ton in one bag. Drone, two Sony bodies, mics, 4 lenses, gopros, filters, cards, batteries, chargers, laptop, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sealock

customer_reviews.title: Great .. but not for casual users..
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Lots of space and utility but very heavy and kind of unusable for casual purposes.
customer_reviews.author: G SREEKANTH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great bag fits all my gear comfortable to wear when out on a walkabout
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Timothy G.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Fits everything I need
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Fits everything I need, it is huge though. It's also super durable, almost a hard case on the top, I can be rough with this bag and not worry about my equipment inside. It fits in normal overhead bins on airplanes but does not on smaller plans. The only flaw that can be a hassle is that to open up the entire bag it opens from the back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite trail backpack for day hikes
customer_reviews.text: My favorite trail backpack for day hikes. Added two Blackrapid backpack sliders and it is working out just grand. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: George K.

customer_reviews.title: Large and durable camera bag.
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than a lot of standard camera bags. Fits comfortably on my back with minimal strain or pressure. If you are a longer/taller person, this is the bag you want to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Blake E.

customer_reviews.title: Only had it for a week but already it's amazing. Really enjoying the versatility of this bag especially ...
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a week but already it's amazing. Really enjoying the versatility of this bag especially the molle system on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hayford

customer_reviews.title: and been very happy in each case
customer_reviews.text: Crazy flexible arrangements. I have repacked it countless ways for very different gear, and been very happy in each case. Having three quick doors to grab things out makes it so fast and easy - it is the king of flexibility.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality high volume backpack
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality backpack with the 15' laptop compartment and nice side entrance without taking off the backpack to reach the camera, the only cons is the shoulder strap is not comfortable when fully load.
customer_reviews.author: Steve.C

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of stuff, durable zippers, very adaptable. Can hold 200-500mm with a D500 attached without trouble.
customer_reviews.author: geeze7017

customer_reviews.title: strong
customer_reviews.text: durable thick padding. dividers could be designed to fit more versatilely
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Poston

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: holds less than i was hoping. 70-200 doesn't fit well when used on full frame body with teleconverter
customer_reviews.author: David J.

customer_reviews.title: Best Bag Ever
customer_reviews.text: This bag has room for everything!! I keep my 70-200 attached all the time and thus bag has no problem holding that along with 3 other lens a flash unit and other usable items...
customer_reviews.author: Ed Stubbs Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Good bag in a good deal with this price discount!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why the company put faded pics but I like the black shine of the bag and of course the capacity. Sturdy, spacious and cool. I like this bag. After searching, testing and evaluating so many bags, i choose this one and didn’t feel wrong. A good bag indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

product_meta.title: Lowepro ProTactic 450 AW Camera Backpack - Professional Protection for Your Camera Gear or DJI Mavic Pro/Mavic Pro Platinum
product_meta.description: Style:ProTactic 450 AWThe ProTactic 450 AW delivers high performance to pro photographers who need an urban-inspired pack that delivers on all fronts: accessibility, versatility, comfort and organization. Customize your kit for the way you shoot. This pack offers limitless set-ups with four ways to access your gear. The robust SlipLock compatible strap system allows you to attach extra gear when you need it. The ActivZone harness provides ventilation and targeted comfort for support on the move. MaxFit System dividers for maximum gear capacity. Protect gear with the built-in All Weather AW Cover. The ProTactic 450 AW fits 1-2 Pro DSLRs, one with up to 70-200mm f/2.8 lens attached 8 lenses/speedlights, a 15" laptop, and a tripod. The ProTactic 450 AW also fits the DJI Mavic Pro drone.
feature_bullets: Never miss a critical mission thanks four access points: the molded, turret-loading top, quick-grab from both sides, and full, back entry for set-up and security
Get versatile with five modular accessories - water bottle pouch, accessory case, tripod cup and two cinch straps - all Slip Lock-compatible and included with pack
ProTactic features ActivZone System technology to deliver targeted support at shoulder blades, lumbar and waist for comfort on the move. Laptop compartment dimensions-11.2x 1.1 x 14.5 inch
Fits 1-2 Pro DSLRs, one with up to 70-200mm f/2.8 lens attached, 8 lenses/speed lights, 15" laptop, tripod and accessories. The ProTactic 450 AW also fits the DJI Mavic Pro drone

Create limitless set-ups with a robust, Slip Lock compatible strap system. Internal Dimensions: 31.8 x 19.8 x 44 cm (12.52 x 7.80 x 17.32 in) External Dimensions: 34.8 x 27 x 48.8 cm (13.70 x 10.63 x 19.21 in). Weight: 2.6 kg (5.72 lbs)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars861 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
